summary: If Arya were to take part in a tourney two things would totally happen: 1. First, she would win no matter which would be her...
body:
If Arya were to take part in a tourney two things would totally happen:

1. First, she would win no matter which would be her opponents bc she’s Arya,

2. She would crown Jon as her “Queen of love and beauty”.

summary: Just had a pretty nerdy thought: Jon burns his right hand - his sword hand - fighting the wight that attacked Jeor Mormont....
body:
Just had a pretty nerdy thought:

Jon burns his right hand - his sword hand - fighting the wight that attacked Jeor Mormont.

Jaime gets his right hand - his sword hand - cut off by the Bolton men.

There is a very significant scene in 1x02 of the two of them shaking hands - back when their right hands were still whole.

Foreshadowing that Jaime Lannister may become Hand of the King to Jon? There’s other book/show references to Jaime being Hand but I’m too lazy to list them. I know Jaime’s likely gonna die next season but this would be…kind of cool, wouldn’t it?

title: Thinking of You - KnottyCricket - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Mature
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
Characters: Jon Snow | Aegon Targaryen, Daenerys Targaryen
Additional Tags: Smut
Series: Part 3 of Sweet Lust
Summary:

He felt the stirrings of a response in her lips, and with a groan that he couldn’t contain, he hooked his hand behind her head. She tasted like sweet oranges. Still with his mouth on hers, they leaned into the bed, letting one hand lower down her gown strap, pressing the other around the tiny waist. He kissed her creamy breasts and her neck audibly. Dany moaned. The hand on her thigh shifted down to her derriere, her breathing quickened.

tags: เกมล่าบัลลังก์
summary: Remember when there was a lot of talk about Kit Harington’s height a couple of years ago? It was kind of silly because Kit is...
caption:
Remember when there was a lot of talk about Kit Harington’s height a couple of years ago? It was kind of silly because Kit is not especially short. Perhaps Jon Snow being seen around tall Wildings like Mance Rayder, Tormund Giantsbane, and Mag the Mighty (AKA: Mag Mar Tun Doh Weg) just made him look shorter to some people.

Such talk has largely dissipated since Jon Snow met Daenerys Targaryen last season. Emilia Clarke is not particularly tall, though she may seem taller because in more recent seasons Daenerys is often seen on or near an elevated throne or riding a dragon. So in terms of height, the two appear well matched.

For people who live in countries with pre-modern measurement systems, Kit Harington is 5′8″ and Emilia Clarke is 5′2″.

tags: i am still not over that hug
thinking about it randomly makes my heart so full
summary:
Mum: You okay?
Me *with tears in my eyes* : uh....yeah 
Mum: What are you thinking?
Me *Jon looked at Sansa as if he had been...
body:
Mum: You okay?

Me *with tears in my eyes* : uh….yeah

Mum: What are you thinking?

Me *Jon looked at Sansa as if he had been starved of looking and her. Then he walked straight into Sansa’s open arms… and they embraced! 😭 After Sansa spent an entire season missing him (“I wish Jon was here”), now she finally got her Jon back… and Jon hugged her after he gave her the “I need You Now” look … From the clip it seems like his face is burried in the crook of her neck!!!!😭 Then Sansa goes into her protective she-wolf mode the second she sees someone behind him😭 … JONSA HUG is the ONLY season 8 clip in the teaser and I WAS NOT EVEN EXPECTING ANOTHER HUG BECAUSE WE ALREADY HAD ONE. NOW WE’RE GETTING ANOTHER ONE. AND I HAVE A LOT OF F E E L I N G S ABOUT THIS*

Me: …Nothing.

Mum: Sure, you’re fine?

Me:

blog.name: kannuckthewolf
blog.title: Too Gay to Function
blog.description: Too opinionated for my own good

tags: a song of ice and fire
body:
Guys…

Why is it that people are like “Sansa’s gonna betray Jon!” and I’m just like “why would she?”. There is no reason for her to betray him. Sansa is a survivalist. She needs Jon to be around as a form of protection for herself. If he dies then she’s screwed. Yes, she’s smart and having Arya around will be beneficial along with Bran’s powers, but Jon is a reminder of their old life and has remained true to Stark honor by having intelligent honor. The people of the North follow him. They respect him. Who knows how they’ll respond to him working with Daenerys Targaryen and pledging himself to her, but we’ll have to wait and see.

Remember, the lone wolf dies while pack survives.

She needs Jon to be around as a form of protection for herself. If he dies then she’s screwed. Yes, she’s smart and having Arya around will be beneficial along with Bran’s powers, but Jon is a reminder of their old life and has remained true to Stark honor by having intelligent honor. The people of the North follow him. They respect him. Who knows how they’ll respond to him working with Daenerys Targaryen and pledging himself to her, but we’ll have to wait and see.

Remember, the lone wolf dies while pack survives.

me: Jon Snow should end up with a strong and powerful woman!
Jonsa and Jonerys shippers: Fuck YES!
me: A girl that became a...
body:
me: Jon Snow should end up with a strong and powerful woman!
Jonsa and Jonerys shippers: Fuck YES!
me: A girl that became a woman through hardships ans pain but kept her kind heart!
Jonsa and Jonerys shippers: YES YES YES!
me: A ruler with a heart of gold that loves and wants to protect her people.
Jonsa and Jonerys shippers: yeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeees!
me: Someone that lost everything which makes her love even more the things she has left.
Jonsa and Jonerys shippers: i cry... YEEES!
me: Remind me why you hate each other again?
Jonsa and Jonerys: What! I can't ship that other bitch! Everything has been handed to her! She is a Mary Sue! She could have done so much more more with what she had. Everybody else is doing her work for her! AAAAAAAAHh!

summary: shinynewrevulsions said:  Curious…How does this fit with Dany in Meereen? Dany invading Westeros?  [“This” is this.] To answer...
body:
shinynewrevulsions said:  Curious…How does this fit with Dany in Meereen? Dany invading Westeros?

[“This” is this.]

To answer that, let me grab a few sentences from the original post.

Virtue alone may not save you, and GRRM’s pushing back against genre conventions where that exact sort of thing happens. The right thing to do might not be clear, and there may be no good solutions to any given moral problem. This does not change any moral imperative to fight injustice and wrongdoing, to try and make the world better, however you are able.

In lockstep parallel with Jon at the Wall, Dany’s experience in Meereen is learning that her good intentions are not enough to effect good outcomes. 

Now, Dany’s attempts to make peace with the slaving class were deeply misguided, but they were also deeply and quite literally selfless. Rather than simply leave Slaver’s Bay for Westeros, and abandoning the people she freed to continuing instability and the possible reemergence of slavery, Dany chose to stay. Over the course of ADWD she sacrifices her identity bit by bit for the lasting peace she wants, until she realises that the peace she’s built is not true peace but her own defeat.

The other thing going on with ADWD and Dany’s good intentions is a building frustration and resentment that those good intentions keep getting thwarted. Again, this is in parallel with Jon’s story, but where Jon withdraws, Dany lashes out. Nobody’s going to be a good person 100% of the time, and Dany’s darker impulses lean towards violence, as we see in the case of the wineseller’s daughters.

What I think we’re going to see in TWoW, from both of them, is a temporary giving up on good intentions (which are so very very difficult to implement) and the costs of that. Personally and to the world around them.
